answers.answer: I think anytime babies get under the 10th percentile, doctors worry! 45th is not bad at all.And the problem with fundal height measurements is that each doctor measures from a different starting point (some above the pubic bone, some at the bottom of it). And each woman's belly will be a different shape and size at different weeks. So long as the ultrasound showed a healthy baby, I wouldn't worry about fundal measurements!

I guess its just that he got so much bigger in the last few weeks that is worrying me, a few weeks ago he was midrange for his gestation, but now he's a more then a week ahead measuring 36w5d (the scan was done at 35 weeks 0d).so he's measuring 36w5 and my fundal height was 33.....i guess i was just shocked by his weight gain

don't forget, fetal growth charts are just an average of how they grow, can't expect baby to stick to it exactly. my baby was growing 8 days older than he is at my last scan and i'm not worried about that in the slightest.
You might want to ask the doctor about induction if you fear he gets too big for you to birth.

question: I am measuring 2 weeks behind on my fundal height but at my biophysical scan the baby's estimated weight (and i know it's only a guess) puts him a week ahead of where he should be. They are keeping an eye beause of my insulin controlled gestational diabetes so baby has potentinal to get big, but my sugars are under control and at 31 weeks my baby was measuring in the 45th precentile so i wasn't to worried but now i am
title: Behind on fundel height, but baby ahead in weight
